content.raw:
Ok I need some help, I am not a catkin or docker expert so I am running dry on ideas.

```
ubuntu@ip-172-31-21-36:~$ ~/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands/fc_run_team_docker.bashrunning team's docker container
/home/ubuntu
xauth:  /tmp/.docker.xauth not writable, changes will be ignored
xauth: (argv):1:  unable to read any entries from file "(stdin)"
libdc1394 error: Failed to initialize libdc1394
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./fc/fc.py", line 29, in <module>
    from srcsim.msg import Task
ImportError: No module named srcsim.msg
```

It looks like the srcsim stuff is not where it needs to be for python.  (srcsim.svr also does not load)

I am using the stanza from scpeters example Dockerfile
```
# clone srcsim
ENV WS /home/docker/ws
RUN mkdir -p ${WS}/src
WORKDIR ${WS}
RUN hg clone #!/osrf/srcsim ${WS}/src/srcsim

# build srcsim messages
RUN . /opt/ros/indigo/setup.sh \
 && catkin config --cmake-args -DBUILD_MSGS_ONLY=True \
 && catkin config --install \
 && catkin build 
```
What am I doing wrong or need to do to get things working..

I even am running with a startup bash script that is doing:
```
#!/bin/bash

source /opt/ros/indigo/setup.sh

/usr/bin/python ./fc/fc.py
```
instead of just trying to run fc/fc.py

thanks!
-aric
